example[0]: to coexist  (=exist together or at the same time)
definition[1]: doing something with someone else as an equal or with less responsibility
example[2]: my co-author  (=someone who wrote the book with me)
example[3]: the co-pilot  (=someone who helps a pilot)
definition[3]: an officer who is in charge of a military unit
definition[5]: added to the front of a noun to show that someone does a job with someone else
example[7]: Her brother is co-director of a medical research firm.
example[8]: The claims will be paid by American International and six other co-insurers.
